result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry J Hiltunen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid FORTHWITH.  In lieu of payment of court costs, defendant to serve an ADDITIONAL 5 day, CONSECUTIVE to the 90 days, but CONCURRENT to the Iron County Case 16CF15.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.

Straight Time.
To be served in the State Prison System.
Concurrent with: Iron County Case 16CF15.
Case 16CM918 was dismissed and read in.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Larry J Hiltunen in court, in custody (OTP'd from Oshkosh Correctional), with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.


Court orders the following:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Concurrent to:  Iron County Case 16CF15.
To be served in the State prison system.
  
Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid Forthwith - In lieu of payment an additional 5 consecutive to the 90 days but concurrent to the Iron County Case 16CF15.

Defendant to be returned to Oshkosh Correctional - FORTHWITH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 22, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
filed, to be produced from Oshkosh Correctional Inst.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with  Connie J.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
